# NSColorPickerTouchBarItem

**Class**

A bar item that provides a system-defined color picker.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSColorPickerTouchBarItem
```

## Overview

For design guidance, see [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/macos/touch-bar/touch-bar-controls-and-views/#color-pickers].

## Creating a color picker item

- **colorPicker(withIdentifier:)**: Creates a bar item with the standard color picker icon.
- **textColorPicker(withIdentifier:)**: Creates a bar item with the standard text color picker icon.
- **strokeColorPicker(withIdentifier:)**: Creates a bar item with the standard stroke color picker icon.
- **colorPicker(withIdentifier:buttonImage:)**: Creates a color picker bar item using the supplied image as its icon.

## Configuring the color picker

- **colorList**: The list of colors displayed in the color picker.
- **allowedColorSpaces**: Controls the color spaces that the color picker can produce.
- **showsAlpha**: A Boolean value that controls whether the color picker allows picking of colors with alpha values other than `1.0`.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether the color picker is enabled.

## Obtaining the selected color

- **color**: The picker’s currently selected color.
- **target**: An object that is notified when a user interacts with the color picker.
- **action**: The selector on the target object that is invoked when a user interacts with the color picker.

## Configuring bar customization

- **customizationLabel**: The user-visible string identifying this item during touch bar customization.

## Color Selection

- **NSColorPicker**: An abstract superclass that implements the default color picking protocol.
- **NSColorWell**: A control that displays a color value and lets the user change that color value.
